summary: This bill, the "Fulfilling Promises to Afghan Allies Act," addresses the resettlement and immigration of Afghan allies who supported the United States mission in Afghanistan. It establishes conditional permanent resident status for eligible individuals, provides pathways for Afghan allies to obtain refugee status, and improves efficiency and oversight of refugee and special immigrant processing. The bill also provides for specific visa programs for certain relatives of members of the US Armed Forces and outlines reporting requirements. Additionally, it aims to prevent fees for these immigration-related processes.
